title.@value: Tentorial tear due to birth injury

definition.@value: Lacerations of tentorium cerebelli due to birth trauma, usually resulting in infratentorial haemorrhages; lesser degrees of tentorial injury most commonly associated with subdural bleeds.

longDefinition.@value: Lacerations of tentorium cerebelli due to birth trauma, usually resulting in infratentorial haemorrhages; or lesser degrees of tentorial injury produced by horizontal or vertical stress on the tentorium after head compression between the vertex and base of the skull or in the occipital-frontal diameter. The stretch of the tentorium leads to rupture of the tributaries of Galenâ€™s vein at its fixed juncture to the straight sinus. Tentorial tear is most commonly associated with a subdural hematoma. A second cause of tentorial tearing is occipital osteodiastasis

label.@value: Tentorial tear due to birth injury
tentorial tear due to birth trauma
